intro: Hieracium odontomestum, commonly known as the toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive toothed margin, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. The plant has a long flowering period, usually from late spring to early autumn.
